    and their tongue stuck to the roof of their mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the ear heard, it called me blessed,
    and when the eye saw, it approved,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because I delivered the poor who cried for help,
    and the fatherless who had none to help him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The blessing of him who was about to perish came upon me,
    and I caused the widow's heart to sing for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I put on righteousness, and it clothed me;
    my justice was like a robe and a turban.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was eyes to the blind
    and feet to the lame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was a father to the needy,
    and I searched out the cause of him whom I did not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I broke the fangs of the unrighteous
    and made him drop his prey from his teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I thought, ‘I shall die in my nest,
    and I shall multiply my days as the sand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
my roots spread out to the waters,
    with the dew all night on my branches,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
my glory fresh with me,
    and my bow ever new in my hand.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Men listened to me and waited
    and kept silence for my counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After I spoke they did not speak again,
    and my word dropped upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They waited for me as for the rain,
    and they opened their mouths as for the spring rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I smiled on them when they had no confidence,
    and the light of my face they did not cast down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I chose their way and sat as chief,
    and I lived like a king among his troops,
    like one who comforts mourners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But now they laugh at me,
    men who are younger than I,
whose fathers I would have disdained
    to set with the dogs of my flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What could I gain from the strength of their hands,
    men whose vigour is gone?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through want and hard hunger
    they gnaw the dry ground by night in waste and desolation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they pick saltwort and the leaves of bushes,
    and the roots of the broom tree for their food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are driven out from human company;
    they shout after them as after a thief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the gullies of the torrents they must dwell,
    in holes of the earth and of the rocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Among the bushes they bray;
    under the nettles they huddle together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A senseless, a nameless brood,
    they have been whipped out of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And now I have become their song;
    I am a byword to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They abhor me; they keep aloof from me;
    they do not hesitate to spit at the sight of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because God has loosed my cord and humbled me,
    they have cast off restraint in my presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
As through a wide breach they come;
    amid the crash they roll on.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“And now my soul is poured out within me;
    days of affliction have taken hold of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The night racks my bones,
    and the pain that gnaws me takes no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With great force my garment is disfigured;
    it binds me about like the collar of my tunic.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God has cast me into the mire,
    and I have become like dust and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cry to you for help and you do not answer me;
    I stand, and you only look at me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have turned cruel to me;
    with the might of your hand you persecute me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You lift me up on the wind; you make me ride on it,
    and you toss me about in the roar of the storm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I know that you will bring me to death
    and to the house appointed for all living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Yet does not one in a heap of ruins stretch out his hand,
    and in his disaster cry for help?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Did not I weep for him whose day was hard?
    Was not my soul grieved for the needy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But when I hoped for good, evil came,
    and when I waited for light, darkness came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My inward parts are in turmoil and never still;
    days of affliction come to meet me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I go about darkened, but not by the sun;
    I stand up in the assembly and cry for help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am a brother of jackals
    and a companion of ostriches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My skin turns black and falls from me,
    and my bones burn with heat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My lyre is turned to mourning,
    and my pipe to the voice of those who weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have made a covenant with my eyes;
    how then could I gaze at a virgin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What would be my portion from God above
    and my heritage from the Almighty on high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is not calamity for the unrighteous,
    and disaster for the workers of iniquity?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does not he see my ways
    and number all my steps?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If I have walked with falsehood
    and my foot has hastened to deceit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(Let me be weighed in a just balance,
    and let God know my integrity!)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if my step has turned aside from the way
    and my heart has gone after my eyes,
    and if any spot has stuck to my hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then let me sow, and another eat,
    and let what grows for me be rooted out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If my heart has been enticed towards a woman,
    and I have lain in wait at my neighbour's door,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then let my wife grind for another,
    and let others bow down on her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For that would be a heinous crime;
    that would be an iniquity to be punished by the judges;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for that would be a fire that consumes as far as Abaddon,
    and it would burn to the root all my increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If I have rejected the cause of my manservant or my maidservant,
    when they brought a complaint against me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
what then shall I do when God rises up?
    When he makes enquiry, what shall I answer him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Did not he who made me in the womb make him?
    And did not one fashion us in the womb?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If I have withheld anything that the poor desired,
    or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
or have eaten my morsel alone,
    and the fatherless has not eaten of it
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(for from my youth the fatherless grew up with me as with a father,
    and from my mother's womb I guided the widow),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if I have seen anyone perish for lack of clothing,
    or the needy without covering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if his body has not blessed me,
    and if he was not warmed with the fleece of my sheep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if I have raised my hand against the fatherless,
    because I saw my help in the gate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then let my shoulder blade fall from my shoulder,
    and let my arm be broken from its socket.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I was in terror of calamity from God,
    and I could not have faced his majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If I have made gold my trust
    or called fine gold my confidence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if I have rejoiced because my wealth was abundant
    or because my hand had found much,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if I have looked at the sun when it shone,
    or the moon moving in splendour,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and my heart has been secretly enticed,
    and my mouth has kissed my hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
this also would be an iniquity to be punished by the judges,
    for I would have been false to God above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If I have rejoiced at the ruin of him who hated me,
    or exulted when evil overtook him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(I have not let my mouth sin
    by asking for his life with a curse),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if the men of my tent have not said,
    ‘Who is there that has not been filled with his meat?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(the sojourner has not lodged in the street;
    I have opened my doors to the traveller),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if I have concealed my transgressions as others do
    by hiding my iniquity in my bosom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because I stood in great fear of the multitude,
    and the contempt of families terrified me,
    so that I kept silence, and did not go out of doors—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, that I had one to hear me!
    (Here is my signature! Let the Almighty answer me!)
    Oh, that I had the indictment written by my adversary!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely I would carry it on my shoulder;
    I would bind it on me as a crown;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would give him an account of all my steps;
    like a prince I would approach him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If my land has cried out against me
    and its furrows have wept together,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if I have eaten its yield without payment
    and made its owners breathe their last,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram, burned with anger. He burned with anger at Job because he justified himself rather than God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He burned with anger also at Job's three friends because they had found no answer, although they had declared Job to be in the wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Elihu had waited to speak to Job because they were older than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, he burned with anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said:
“I am young in years,
    and you are aged;
therefore I was timid and afraid
    to declare my opinion to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I said, ‘Let days speak,
    and many years teach wisdom.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But it is the spirit in man,
    the breath of the Almighty, that makes him understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not the old who are wise,
    nor the aged who understand what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I say, ‘Listen to me;
    let me also declare my opinion.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I waited for your words,
    I listened for your wise sayings,
    while you searched out what to say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I gave you my attention,
    and, behold, there was none among you who refuted Job
    or who answered his words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Beware lest you say, ‘We have found wisdom;
    God may vanquish him, not a man.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has not directed his words against me,
    and I will not answer him with your speeches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They are dismayed; they answer no more;
    they have not a word to say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And shall I wait, because they do not speak,
    because they stand there, and answer no more?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I also will answer with my share;
    I also will declare my opinion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I am full of words;
    the spirit within me constrains me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, my belly is like wine that has no vent;
    like new wineskins ready to burst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I must speak, that I may find relief;
    I must open my lips and answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not show partiality to any man
    or use flattery towards any person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I do not know how to flatter,
    else my Maker would soon take me away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But now, hear my speech, O Job,
    and listen to all my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I open my mouth;
    the tongue in my mouth speaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My words declare the uprightness of my heart,
    and what my lips know they speak sincerely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Spirit of God has made me,
    and the breath of the Almighty gives me life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Answer me, if you can;
    set your words in order before me; take your stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I am towards God as you are;
    I too was pinched off from a piece of clay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, no fear of me need terrify you;
    my pressure will not be heavy upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Surely you have spoken in my ears,
    and I have heard the sound of your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You say, ‘I am pure, without transgression;
    I am clean, and there is no iniquity in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, he finds occasions against me,
    he counts me as his enemy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he puts my feet in the stocks
    and watches all my paths.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, in this you are not right. I will answer you,
    for God is greater than man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you contend against him,
    saying, ‘He will answer none of man's words’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God speaks in one way,
    and in two, though man does not perceive it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
then he opens the ears of men
    and terrifies them with warnings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that he may turn man aside from his deed
    and conceal pride from a man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he keeps back his soul from the pit,
    his life from perishing by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Man is also rebuked with pain on his bed
    and with continual strife in his bones,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that his life loathes bread,
    and his appetite the choicest food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His flesh is so wasted away that it cannot be seen,
    and his bones that were not seen stick out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His soul draws near the pit,
    and his life to those who bring death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If there be for him an angel,
    a mediator, one of the thousand,
    to declare to man what is right for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
let his flesh become fresh with youth;
    let him return to the days of his youthful vigour’;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He sings before men and says:
‘I sinned and perverted what was right,
    and it was not repaid to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has redeemed my soul from going down into the pit,
    and my life shall look upon the light.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, God does all these things,
    twice, three times, with a man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to bring back his soul from the pit,
    that he may be lighted with the light of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pay attention, O Job, listen to me;
    be silent, and I will speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you have any words, answer me;
    speak, for I desire to justify you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If not, listen to me;
    be silent, and I will teach you wisdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Elihu answered and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear my words, you wise men,
    and give ear to me, you who know;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the ear tests words
    as the palate tastes food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us choose what is right;
    let us know among ourselves what is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Job has said, ‘I am in the right,
    and God has taken away my right;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in spite of my right I am counted a liar;
    my wound is incurable, though I am without transgression.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What man is like Job,
    who drinks up scoffing like water,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who travels in company with evildoers
    and walks with wicked men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he has said, ‘It profits a man nothing
    that he should take delight in God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore, hear me, you men of understanding:
    far be it from God that he should do wickedness,
    and from the Almighty that he should do wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For according to the work of a man he will repay him,
    and according to his ways he will make it befall him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of a truth, God will not do wickedly,
    and the Almighty will not pervert justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who gave him charge over the earth,
    and who laid on him the whole world?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If he should set his heart to it
    and gather to himself his spirit and his breath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
all flesh would perish together,
    and man would return to dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If you have understanding, hear this;
    listen to what I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall one who hates justice govern?
    Will you condemn him who is righteous and mighty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who says to a king, ‘Worthless one’,
    and to nobles, ‘Wicked man’,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who shows no partiality to princes,
    nor regards the rich more than the poor,
    for they are all the work of his hands?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“For his eyes are on the ways of a man,
    and he sees all his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no gloom or deep darkness
    where evildoers may hide themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God has no need to consider a man further,
    that he should go before God in judgement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shatters the mighty without investigation
    and sets others in their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus, knowing their works,
    he overturns them in the night, and they are crushed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He strikes them for their wickedness
    in a place for all to see,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because they turned aside from following him
    and had no regard for any of his ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that they caused the cry of the poor to come to him,
    and he heard the cry of the afflicted—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he is quiet, who can condemn?
    When he hides his face, who can behold him,
    whether it be a nation or a man?—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that a godless man should not reign,
    that he should not ensnare the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For has anyone said to God,
    ‘I have borne punishment; I will not offend any more;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
teach me what I do not see;
    if I have done iniquity, I will do it no more’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will he then make repayment to suit you,
    because you reject it?
For you must choose, and not I;
    therefore declare what you know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Men of understanding will say to me,
    and the wise man who hears me will say:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Job speaks without knowledge;
    his words are without insight.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Would that Job were tried to the end,
    because he answers like wicked men.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: And Elihu answered and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do you think this to be just?
    Do you say, ‘It is my right before God’,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that you ask, ‘What advantage have I?
    How am I better off than if I had sinned?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will answer you
    and your friends with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look at the heavens, and see;
    and behold the clouds, which are higher than you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you have sinned, what do you accomplish against him?
    And if your transgressions are multiplied, what do you do to him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you are righteous, what do you give to him?
    Or what does he receive from your hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wickedness concerns a man like yourself,
    and your righteousness a son of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Because of the multitude of oppressions people cry out;
    they call for help because of the arm of the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But none says, ‘Where is God my Maker,
    who gives songs in the night,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who teaches us more than the beasts of the earth
    and makes us wiser than the birds of the heavens?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There they cry out, but he does not answer,
    because of the pride of evil men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely God does not hear an empty cry,
    nor does the Almighty regard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much less when you say that you do not see him,
    that the case is before him, and you are waiting for him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And now, because his anger does not punish,
    and he does not take much note of transgression,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Job opens his mouth in empty talk;
    he multiplies words without knowledge.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Elihu continued, and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Bear with me a little, and I will show you,
    for I have yet something to say on God's behalf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will get my knowledge from afar
    and ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For truly my words are not false;
    one who is perfect in knowledge is with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, God is mighty, and does not despise any;
    he is mighty in strength of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He does not keep the wicked alive,
    but gives the afflicted their right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He does not withdraw his eyes from the righteous,
    but with kings on the throne
    he sets them for ever, and they are exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And if they are bound in chains
    and caught in the cords of affliction,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then he declares to them their work
    and their transgressions, that they are behaving arrogantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He opens their ears to instruction
    and commands that they return from iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If they listen and serve him,
    they complete their days in prosperity,
    and their years in pleasantness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But if they do not listen, they perish by the sword
    and die without knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The godless in heart cherish anger;
    they do not cry for help when he binds them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They die in youth,
    and their life ends among the cult prostitutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He delivers the afflicted by their affliction
    and opens their ear by adversity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also allured you out of distress
    into a broad place where there was no cramping,
    and what was set on your table was full of fatness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But you are full of the judgement on the wicked;
    judgement and justice seize you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Beware lest wrath entice you into scoffing,
    and let not the greatness of the ransom turn you aside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will your cry for help avail to keep you from distress,
    or all the force of your strength?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not long for the night,
    when peoples vanish in their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take care; do not turn to iniquity,
    for this you have chosen rather than affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, God is exalted in his power;
    who is a teacher like him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has prescribed for him his way,
    or who can say, ‘You have done wrong’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Remember to extol his work,
    of which men have sung.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All mankind has looked on it;
    man beholds it from afar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, God is great, and we know him not;
    the number of his years is unsearchable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he draws up the drops of water;
    they distil his mist in rain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
which the skies pour down
    and drop on mankind abundantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can anyone understand the spreading of the clouds,
    the thunderings of his pavilion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, he scatters his lightning about him
    and covers the roots of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For by these he judges peoples;
    he gives food in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He covers his hands with the lightning
    and commands it to strike the mark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Its crashing declares his presence;
    the cattle also declare that he rises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“At this also my heart trembles
    and leaps out of its place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep listening to the thunder of his voice
    and the rumbling that comes from his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Under the whole heaven he lets it go,
    and his lightning to the corners of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God thunders wondrously with his voice;
    he does great things that we cannot comprehend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For to the snow he says, ‘Fall on the earth’,
    likewise to the downpour, his mighty downpour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He seals up the hand of every man,
    that all men whom he made may know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the beasts go into their lairs,
    and remain in their dens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From its chamber comes the whirlwind,
    and cold from the scattering winds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the breath of God ice is given,
    and the broad waters are frozen fast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He loads the thick cloud with moisture;
    the clouds scatter his lightning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They turn round and round by his guidance,
    to accomplish all that he commands them
    on the face of the habitable world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whether for correction or for his land
    or for love, he causes it to happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear this, O Job;
    stop and consider the wondrous works of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you know how God lays his command upon them
    and causes the lightning of his cloud to shine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you know the balancings of the clouds,
    the wondrous works of him who is perfect in knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you whose garments are hot
    when the earth is still because of the south wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can you, like him, spread out the skies,
    hard as a cast-metal mirror?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach us what we shall say to him;
    we cannot draw up our case because of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall it be told him that I would speak?
    Did a man ever wish that he would be swallowed up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And now no one looks on the light
    when it is bright in the skies,
    when the wind has passed and cleared them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of the north comes golden splendour;
    God is clothed with awesome majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore men fear him;
    he does not regard any who are wise in their own conceit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord answered Job out of the whirlwind and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who is this that darkens counsel by words without knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Dress for action like a man;
    I will question you, and you make it known to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Where were you when I laid the foundation of the earth?
    Tell me, if you have understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who determined its measurements—surely you know!
    Or who stretched the line upon it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On what were its bases sunk,
    or who laid its cornerstone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when the morning stars sang together
    and all the sons of God shouted for joy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Or who shut in the sea with doors
    when it burst out from the womb,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when I made clouds its garment
    and thick darkness its swaddling band,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and prescribed limits for it
    and set bars and doors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and said, ‘Thus far shall you come, and no farther,
    and here shall your proud waves be stayed’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Have you commanded the morning since your days began,
    and caused the dawn to know its place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that it might take hold of the skirts of the earth,
    and the wicked be shaken out of it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is changed like clay under the seal,
    and its features stand out like a garment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the wicked their light is withheld,
    and their uplifted arm is broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Have you entered into the springs of the sea,
    or walked in the recesses of the deep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have the gates of death been revealed to you,
    or have you seen the gates of deep darkness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you comprehended the expanse of the earth?
    Declare, if you know all this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Where is the way to the dwelling of light,
    and where is the place of darkness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that you may take it to its territory
    and that you may discern the paths to its home?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You know, for you were born then,
    and the number of your days is great!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Have you entered the storehouses of the snow,
    or have you seen the storehouses of the hail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
which I have reserved for the time of trouble,
    for the day of battle and war?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What is the way to the place where the light is distributed,
    or where the east wind is scattered upon the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who has cleft a channel for the torrents of rain
    and a way for the thunderbolt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to bring rain on a land where no man is,
    on the desert in which there is no man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to satisfy the waste and desolate land,
    and to make the ground sprout with grass?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Has the rain a father,
    or who has begotten the drops of dew?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From whose womb did the ice come forth,
    and who has given birth to the frost of heaven?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The waters become hard like stone,
    and the face of the deep is frozen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Can you bind the chains of the Pleiades
    or loose the cords of Orion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can you lead forth the Mazzaroth in their season,
    or can you guide the Bear with its children?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you know the ordinances of the heavens?
    Can you establish their rule on the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Can you lift up your voice to the clouds,
    that a flood of waters may cover you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can you send forth lightnings, that they may go
    and say to you, ‘Here we are’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has put wisdom in the inward parts
    or given understanding to the mind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can number the clouds by wisdom?
    Or who can tilt the waterskins of the heavens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when the dust runs into a mass
    and the clods stick fast together?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Can you hunt the prey for the lion,
    or satisfy the appetite of the young lions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when they crouch in their dens
    or lie in wait in their thicket?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who provides for the raven its prey,
    when its young ones cry to God for help,
    and wander about for lack of food?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do you know when the mountain goats give birth?
    Do you observe the calving of the does?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can you number the months that they fulfil,
    and do you know the time when they give birth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when they crouch, bring forth their offspring,
    and are delivered of their young?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their young ones become strong; they grow up in the open;
    they go out and do not return to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who has let the wild donkey go free?
    Who has loosed the bonds of the swift donkey,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to whom I have given the arid plain for his home
    and the salt land for his dwelling place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He scorns the tumult of the city;
    he hears not the shouts of the driver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He ranges the mountains as his pasture,
    and he searches after every green thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Is the wild ox willing to serve you?
    Will he spend the night at your manger?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can you bind him in the furrow with ropes,
    or will he harrow the valleys after you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you depend on him because his strength is great,
    and will you leave to him your labour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you have faith in him that he will return your grain
    and gather it to your threshing floor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The wings of the ostrich wave proudly,
    but are they the pinions and plumage of love?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For she leaves her eggs to the earth
    and lets them be warmed on the ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
forgetting that a foot may crush them
    and that the wild beast may trample them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She deals cruelly with her young, as if they were not hers;
    though her labour be in vain, yet she has no fear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because God has made her forget wisdom
    and given her no share in understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When she rouses herself to flee,
    she laughs at the horse and his rider.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do you give the horse his might?
    Do you clothe his neck with a mane?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you make him leap like the locust?
    His majestic snorting is terrifying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He paws in the valley and exults in his strength;
    he goes out to meet the weapons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He laughs at fear and is not dismayed;
    he does not turn back from the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Upon him rattle the quiver,
    the flashing spear, and the javelin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With fierceness and rage he swallows the ground;
    he cannot stand still at the sound of the trumpet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the trumpet sounds, he says ‘Aha!’
    He smells the battle from afar,
    the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Is it by your understanding that the hawk soars
    and spreads his wings towards the south?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it at your command that the eagle mounts up
    and makes his nest on high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the rock he dwells and makes his home,
    on the rocky crag and stronghold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From there he spies out the prey;
    his eyes behold it from far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His young ones suck up blood,
    and where the slain are, there is he.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Job:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Shall a fault-finder contend with the Almighty?
    He who argues with God, let him answer it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered the Lord and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I am of small account; what shall I answer you?
    I lay my hand on my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have spoken once, and I will not answer;
    twice, but I will proceed no further.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord answered Job out of the whirlwind and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Dress for action like a man;
    I will question you, and you make it known to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you even put me in the wrong?
    Will you condemn me that you may be in the right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you an arm like God,
    and can you thunder with a voice like his?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Adorn yourself with majesty and dignity;
    clothe yourself with glory and splendour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out the overflowings of your anger,
    and look on everyone who is proud and abase him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look on everyone who is proud and bring him low
    and tread down the wicked where they stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hide them all in the dust together;
    bind their faces in the world below.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then will I also acknowledge to you
    that your own right hand can save you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, his strength in his loins,
    and his power in the muscles of his belly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes his tail stiff like a cedar;
    the sinews of his thighs are knit together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His bones are tubes of bronze,
    his limbs like bars of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He is the first of the works of God;
    let him who made him bring near his sword!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the mountains yield food for him
    where all the wild beasts play.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Under the lotus plants he lies,
    in the shelter of the reeds and in the marsh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For his shade the lotus trees cover him;
    the willows of the brook surround him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, if the river is turbulent he is not frightened;
    he is confident though Jordan rushes against his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can one take him by his eyes,
    or pierce his nose with a snare?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Can you draw out Leviathan with a fish-hook
    or press down his tongue with a cord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can you put a rope in his nose
    or pierce his jaw with a hook?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will he make many pleas to you?
    Will he speak to you soft words?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will he make a covenant with you
    to take him for your servant for ever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you play with him as with a bird,
    or will you put him on a leash for your girls?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will traders bargain over him?
    Will they divide him up among the merchants?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can you fill his skin with harpoons
    or his head with fishing spears?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lay your hands on him;
    remember the battle—you will not do it again!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the hope of a man is false;
    he is laid low even at the sight of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one is so fierce that he dares to stir him up.
    Who then is he who can stand before me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has first given to me, that I should repay him?
    Whatever is under the whole heaven is mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will not keep silence concerning his limbs,
    or his mighty strength, or his goodly frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can strip off his outer garment?
    Who would come near him with a bridle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can open the doors of his face?
    Around his teeth is terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His back is made of rows of shields,
    shut up closely as with a seal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One is so near to another
    that no air can come between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are joined one to another;
    they clasp each other and cannot be separated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His sneezings flash forth light,
    and his eyes are like the eyelids of the dawn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of his mouth go flaming torches;
    sparks of fire leap forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of his nostrils comes forth smoke,
    as from a boiling pot and burning rushes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His breath kindles coals,
    and a flame comes forth from his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his neck abides strength,
    and terror dances before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The folds of his flesh stick together,
    firmly cast on him and immovable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His heart is hard as a stone,
    hard as the lower millstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he raises himself up the mighty are afraid;
    at the crashing they are beside themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though the sword reaches him, it does not avail,
    nor the spear, the dart, or the javelin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He counts iron as straw,
    and bronze as rotten wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The arrow cannot make him flee;
    for him sling stones are turned to stubble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Clubs are counted as stubble;
    he laughs at the rattle of javelins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His underparts are like sharp potsherds;
    he spreads himself like a threshing sledge on the mire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He makes the deep boil like a pot;
    he makes the sea like a pot of ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behind him he leaves a shining wake;
    one would think the deep to be white-haired.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On earth there is not his like,
    a creature without fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sees everything that is high;
    he is king over all the sons of pride.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered the Lord and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I know that you can do all things,
    and that no purpose of yours can be thwarted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Who is this that hides counsel without knowledge?’
Therefore I have uttered what I did not understand,
    things too wonderful for me, which I did not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Hear, and I will speak;
    I will question you, and you make it known to me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I had heard of you by the hearing of the ear,
    but now my eye sees you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
therefore I despise myself,
    and repent in dust and ashes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the Lord had spoken these words to Job, the Lord said to Eliphaz the Temanite: “My anger burns against you and against your two friends, for you have not spoken of me what is right, as my servant Job has.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore take seven bulls and seven rams and go to my servant Job and offer up a burnt offering for yourselves. And my servant Job shall pray for you, for I will accept his prayer not to deal with you according to your folly. For you have not spoken of me what is right, as my servant Job has.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went and did what the Lord had told them, and the Lord accepted Job's prayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord restored the fortunes of Job, when he had prayed for his friends. And the Lord gave Job twice as much as he had before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came to him all his brothers and sisters and all who had known him before, and ate bread with him in his house. And they showed him sympathy and comforted him for all the evil that the Lord had brought upon him. And each of them gave him a piece of money and a ring of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord blessed the latter days of Job more than his beginning. And he had 14,000 sheep, 6,000 camels, 1,000 yoke of oxen, and 1,000 female donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had also seven sons and three daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called the name of the first daughter Jemimah, and the name of the second Keziah, and the name of the third Keren-happuch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in all the land there were no women so beautiful as Job's daughters. And their father gave them an inheritance among their brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after this Job lived for 140 years, and saw his sons, and his sons' sons, four generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Job died, an old man, and full of days.
verses.speaker: Narrator
